title: TC001-User Login with Valid Credentials
description: Verify that a user can successfully log in using valid email and password, receiving a JWT token and user details.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Input valid email and password, then submit the login form to verify successful login and JWT token reception.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input valid email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('carlosedufaraujo@outlook.com')
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Login Successful - JWT Token Received').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: User login was not successful, JWT token and valid user details were not received as expected.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode

                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Input invalid email and password, then submit login form to verify failure response
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input invalid email
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('wrongemail@example.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input invalid password
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[3]/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('wrongpassword123')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on Entrar button to submit login form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Login Successful').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test failed: Login should fail with wrong email or password and return 401 Unauthorized response with error message, but the success message was not found.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC003-JWT Token Validation and Role-based Access Control
description: Verify that JWT tokens are required for protected endpoints and users can only access endpoints matching their role permissions.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Input email and password, then submit login form to obtain JWT token.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('carlosedufaraujo@outlook.com')
        

        # -> Click the 'Entrar' button to submit login form and authenticate user.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to submit login form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Re-input password and submit login form again to authenticate user and obtain JWT token.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Re-input password for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[3]/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('368308450Ce*')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to submit login form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/div[2]/div[3]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Input email into index 2, password into index 4, then click submit button at index 8 to login and obtain JWT token.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('carlosedufaraujo@outlook.com')
        

        # -> Click the 'Entrar' button to submit login form and authenticate user to obtain JWT token.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to submit login form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Re-input password into index 5 and submit login form by clicking button at index 9 to authenticate user and obtain JWT token.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Re-input password for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[3]/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('368308450Ce*')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to submit login form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Access Granted with Valid JWT').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test failed: JWT token validation and role-based access control did not pass as expected. Access was not granted with a valid JWT and correct role, or access denial messages (401 Unauthorized, 403 Forbidden) were not properly handled.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Input email and password, then click Entrar button to login
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('carlosedufaraujo@outlook.com')
        

        # -> Click Entrar button to submit login form and login
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to submit login form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Re-input password correctly and click Entrar button to submit login form
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Re-input password for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[3]/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('368308450Ce*')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to submit login form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Paginated cattle purchase records loaded successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The GET /api/v1/cattle-purchases endpoint did not return a paginated list of purchase records or support filtering by date range and vendor as expected.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Input email and password, then click 'Entrar' to log in.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('carlosedufaraujo@outlook.com')
        

        # -> Click 'Entrar' button to log in and proceed to the main application.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Entrar' button to submit login form and log in
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Financial Data Unavailable').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: API did not provide correct financial analytics data on revenues, expenses, and cash flow within expected response time as per the test plan.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC020-Automated Cleanup of Test Data
description: Verify the test data cleanup endpoint correctly removes test data from the system without affecting production data.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Input email and password, then submit login form
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('carlosedufaraujo@outlook.com')
        

        # -> Click the 'Entrar' button to submit login form and login
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Re-input password correctly and click 'Entrar' button to login
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Re-input password for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[3]/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('368308450Ce*')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click the 'Entrar' button to submit login form and attempt login
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Entrar' button to login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Re-input email and password correctly and click 'Entrar' button to login
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Re-input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('carlosedufaraujo@outlook.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Re-input password for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[3]/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('368308450Ce*')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Entrar' button to login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Insert test data via test data API
        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173/api/v1/test-data/insert', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Call the DELETE /api/v1/test-data/cleanup endpoint to clean up test data after insertion
        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173/api/v1/test-data/cleanup', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Verify test data removal and production data integrity by checking relevant data endpoints
        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173/api/v1/data/verify', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Test Data Cleanup Successful').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test plan execution failed: The test data cleanup endpoint did not remove test data correctly or affected production data. Immediate failure triggered.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
